title: Strong typhoon forces cancellation of flights in Taiwan - Travelandtourworld.comTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Strong typhoon forces cancellation of flights in Taiwan
Taiwan has been facing rough weather with strong typhoon winds and heavy rain leaving several dead and injured. The official death toll is three. Flight and rail services have been cancelled.
The wind velocity has been recorded at 230km/h (142mph). Strong winds are causing land falls, uprooting trees, and tearing billboards. The wind is said to move across the island.
There is no electricity in about two million households. The officials have ordered schools to be cancelled.
However there has been some assurance from the weather bureau, the typhoon is moving North West and is gradually losing strength.
Thousands have been evacuated from their homes. An eight year old girl and her mother were swept out to sea.
Tourists in Taiwan should take care and try and stay indoors, those who can, should defer their travel plans. Strong winds have been reported across virtually all of Taiwanâ€™s large population centers.
